title: Alphabet’s Earnings Disappointed the Street. Blame Its Equity Holdings.
text:
Google’s parent, Alphabet, is trading modestly lower after the internet search and advertising giant posted weaker-than-expected third-quarter profits, a shortfall apparently tied to the company’s equity investments, rather than operating factors.

For the quarter, Alphabet (ticker: GOOGL) reported revenues of $40.499 billion, up 20% year over year, or 22% in constant currency, ahead of the Street consensus at $40.32 billion. But profits of $10.12 a share were down from $13.12 a share a year ago, and well below the Street consensus...
description: Google’s parent, Alphabet, is trading modestly lower after the internet search and advertising giant posted weaker-than-expected third-quarter profits, a shortfall apparently tied to the company’s equity investments, rather than operating factors.
